intro: Poecilocalyx stipulosa, commonly known as the hairy-stipule flame tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, red-orange flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators.
